intro: Pimelea behrii, commonly known as the yellow mistflower, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its dense, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine, silky hairs. Pimelea behrii is well adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands and heathlands.
